subject: Ethics
title: Fossil Fuel Divestment Ethics
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Fossil Fuel Divestment Ethics.

hook.text: Harvard's $42 billion endowment included fossil fuel stocks for decades. Students demanded: divest now.

buildup.text: Divestment means selling off investments in fossil fuel companies as a moral and financial statement.

discovery.text: The movement argues that profiting from climate destruction makes institutions morally complicit.

twist.text: Critics say divestment is symbolicâ€”someone else just buys those stocks. The oil keeps flowing.

climax.text: But South Africa showed divestment works. Financial pressure helped end apartheid. Climate is next.

punchline.text: Your money talks. Divestment decides what it says.

quiz.question: What is the main argument for fossil fuel divestment?
options: Profiting from climate destruction makes investors morally complicit
Fossil fuel stocks always lose money
Divestment immediately shuts down fossil fuel companies
